data.title: Heidi Klum to remove ex-husband Seal's name from tattoo
data.meta_description: Supermodel Heidi Klum is reportedly planning to remove her tattoo featuring the name of her former musician-husband Seal.
data.text:
Heidi Klum's tattoo featured her former spouse's name and the initials of their four kids.

Highlights

Supermodel Heidi Klum is reportedly planning to remove her tattoo featuring the name of her former musician-husband Seal.

The 40-year-old had the tattoo, which features her former spouse's name and the initials of their four kids set inside stars. It was done to commemorate their fourth wedding anniversary, but following their 2012 split, she is now having it erased.

"Heidi is in the process of getting her tattoo removed. She's been through a few treatments. The stars with her children's initials will stay intact," femalefirst.co.uk quoted a source as saying.

Klum, who is currently dating her bodyguard Martin Kristen, recently said that she isn't interested in marrying again because she has lived that "fairytale".

The supermodel was first married to stylist Ric Pipino for around five years (1997-2002) and after a brief romance with businessman Flavio Briatore, she tied the knot with Seal in May 2005.

Klum, who has four children - Leni, 9, Henry, 7, Johan, 6, and Lou, 3, with Seal - has also ruled out having another child because she feels that her family is "complete".

"I don't really want to have more children. Four is a lot of children and I feel complete," she said.
